data.title: Sushi + Service = Express Lunch
data.text: Several lunch specials and quick service make this an excellent place to pop in for lunch if you're time constrained!   A frequent diner punch card is also offered, so take advantage of that if you're in the area frequently.

data.title: Good food, lacking service...
data.text:
We were downtown for the Coldplay concert and we were looking for somewhere to have dinner. My aunt is a huge fan of The Sushi Place and has told me to go so many times. Since it was just a block down from the BOK Center, we decided to give it a shot. We went in right about 6 or so and were able to get the last table without having to wait. 

The interior of the restaurant is tiny. There were maybe a dozen tables total, and even most of those only sat two people. The restaurant was very busy and it was obvious that the wait staff were overwhelmed. It took our server a little while to even get over to us to give us a menu. It was an even longer wait to get a drink and place an order. 

We decided to try the 918 Crunch Roll, Naughty Roll, and Volcano Roll. The food was also pretty slow getting to us. Once we were served, our food was very good. I wouldn't say this is the best sushi I have ever had, but it is definitely some of the better sushi I have had in Tulsa. I would rank it #2 or #3. By far, the best roll was the Naughty Roll. It just was excellent. The 918 Crunch Roll was also very good. The Volcano Roll was a little more on the lacking side. Some pieces were incredibly spicy, and some had very little flavor. It just wasn't very consistent. 

When we were finished, we waited for a LONG time for a check. It seemed at this point that the restaurant was down to only a single server (there were only two to begin with) and he was absolutely swamped. We eventually walked up to the counter to get a check so we could pay and get to our concert. I don't know if this is normal or not, but there definitely needs to be more staff out working the floor. The food was really good and I would have easily given this place a 5 star rating had it not been for the lacking service. I think a rating of 3 1/2 stars seems about right, but since I can't give half stars, I will round it up to four.

data.title: Quaint Enviroment with Great Food
data.text: I enjoyed my experience thoroughly.  Friendly waitstaff, quaint atmosphere, delicious food.  I started with the Ika salad, followed by Gyoza and finished up with the Crunch Roll. Very tasty indeed!!!!

data.title: just wonderful
data.text: i work downtown & love this little find. calamari salad was awesome, i loved the spicy tuna roll & the miso was excellent. my server was the best, really. now a regular lunch space.

data.title: Great food, good value near BOK Center
data.text: We ordered a variety of Nigiri and rolls, as well as miso soup and green tree ice cream for dessert -- all of our favorites. Everything was excellent! The Riesling wine was delicious, too. The miso soup was some of the best I've ever had, and the 918 Crunchy Roll is not to be missed. We had to order more!

data.title: Good lunch choice
data.text: A good find for sushi downtown.  Had the sushi bowls and the salt & pepper octopus.  Not crowded, friendly server, and we were able to get in and out in an hour.

data.title: Where is a good place for Sushi?  At The Sushi Place!
data.text: Our family enjoys The Sushi Place, and we've visited many times, particularly when we have events downtown.  There are plenty of sushi options on the menu, some of which are unique to this cafe.  We've not been disappointed in anything we've ordered.  Always fresh-tasting, with good service at the table.  It's also a good sign when the proprietor comes to the table to check on how we liked our dinner...she works hard and runs a good establishment.  Give it a try!

data.title: Just alright sushi
data.text: Recently ate here before a concert at the BOK since its just down the street and was a little let down. Sushi was just average and all seem to taste the same. Nothing stood out as just great and for the price, it should have. Much better sushi just a few blocks from here at Yokozuna.

data.title: Very quick, delicious lunch
data.text: The lunch box is great.  I got miso, spicy tuna roll, and pork wontons(?).  The service was very fast and the price was about what I'd expect for good sushi.  I will return.

data.title: Great Lunch Box
data.text: Great quality and fast service! Seaweed salad was awesome, potstickers good and 918 crunch roll was amazing!!! Got my punch card and I WILL be back. Right across from my office.

data.title: Not So Much...
data.text:
I recently purchased a Living Social coupon for The Sushi Place and my husband and I used it last night for our date night dinner.  The coupon included two salads, two bowls of Miso soup, edamame, a 918 roll and two entrees off of a special “Living Social” menu.  

While we were looking at the menu, the chef/owner brought us a small plate of an appetizer she’d created to get our opinions (as well as several other diners).  It was an avocado/wasabi combination topped with small bites of fried chicken and some type of “crunchies”.  It was actually the best thing we ate all night!

Our server began our meal by bringing our soups and salads out together.  Before we were even half way through that she brought out the edamame.  The soup was pretty much tasteless and luke warm, the salad was okay although very hard to eat with chopsticks (only utensils we were given to eat with) and it needed more dressing; it also was topped with the “crunchies”.   The edamame was luke warm and lacked flavor as well.  

Our server then brought out our entrees which included another salad, a cup of rice, a small fried chicken piece and a bowl of sauce (I had teriyaki and my husband had curry).  The teriyaki sauce was thin and tasted a lot like the miso soup did.  The curry had some bite, but it was very thin as well and except for the bite didn’t have any flavor.  We were told that we were supposed to add the chicken into the rice portion of our bento box and then pour the sauce over it.  By the time we did that, our rice was floating and again it became almost impossible to eat with chopsticks.
The 918 roll was brought to the table at the same time as the entrees and it was okay but nothing really special but it was rolled in the same “crunchies” as the salad and small plate.  The soy sauce completely overpowered the taste of the roll which was disappointing; I was really looking forward to a good sushi roll.

Keep in mind that our food was being served with rapid fire precision and our plates were not being removed as we finished one course and began another.  We were sitting at a table for two and by the time we were finished the table was covered with dishes (pet peeve of mine).

The restaurant is located downtown and parking was not convenient.  It is a very small place with seating for about 40 and with the extremely high ceilings it became quite noisy and there were only about 10 people eating dinner, so definitely not someplace to be able to sit and chat comfortably with your dinner companions if there are other diners there.

All in all, the meal we had would have cost us well over $60.00 without the Living Social coupon and we can spend that amount or less and have a much better meal at another restaurant.  My husband normally gets sake and a beer with his sushi; however, last night he had water because the sake/beer combo would have cost us around $20.00.  Bottom line, save your money and go somewhere else if you’re dining downtown and/or craving sushi.

data.title: So so...
data.text: Hmmm... Well, we ordered and seaweed salad to share.  It arrived in a bowl with mixed greens.  I've never seen that before.  Kinda strange.  We also ordered to Tsing Tao beers that were not as cold as they should have been.  The roll we ordered was ok and the service was lacking.  We ate and split.

data.title: Good Sushi quick
data.text: Great lunch place for sushi lovers.  Order at the counter, not wait staff.  I don't think the serve alcohol, though.  Enjoyed a lot.

data.title: Deliciously Fresh, Unique and Great Service
data.text:
Jamie has figured out how to make and serve consistently delicious sushi and other creations.  Everything is fresh, service is awesome. Especially for regulars, Steven knows what we want and provides service with a smile.
Stop in and you will be in on one of our best kept secrets, The Sushi Place not to missed.
918 is our favorite roll.

data.title: One of my favorite sushi restaurants
data.text: I love The Sushi Place. They make their own tempura from rice flower so I can eat it (I'm gluten free). Their soft-shelled crab with lemon sauce is to die for. So is their salt and pepper octopus. I've eaten here many times and never been disappointed. Don't forget to ask for a punch card.

data.title: Great easy lunch sushi
data.text: I work downtown quite a bit, and love eating lunch here. Great lunch specials, nice staff, easy in and out. I'm comfortable here by myself or with clients. Hole-in-the-wall appearance, but nicer than that inside. Not fancy but nice!  I'm a frequent diner here and will continue to be!

data.title: Good sushi, quick service, and reasonable prices
data.text:
We were in somewhat of a hurry to get to a concert, but went in due to crowding and wait times at other nearby restaurants.
The sampler platter was a good combination of a variety of rolls, with nothing really spicy (good for my 15 year old son, but somewhat disappointing my 17 year old).
Service was pretty good, especially considering the crowd and small restaurant size.
There is only one restroom, so there may be a wait if that is needed.

data.title: Friendly service and delicious sushi
data.text: Wow! Not what you would expect in Tulsa.  The service was so friendly, the food came out quickly and the sushi was delicious.  I like my sushi spicy and this definitely was spicy and delicious.  Yum!

data.title: Soectacular. Must go
data.text:
My daughter said get the veggie bowl with green tea noodles. I hate green tea. This was possibly one of the best meals I have had In a long time. You will simply not believe this dish. 

Unreal taste. It comes with some veggies tempura style.  I did not have any sushi. This veggie bowl was simply spectacular.

data.title: Nice atmospher, great sushi
data.text:
Stopped here for a light meal before heading to a concert. The atmosphere was pleasant and warm. The sushi was good and the service fast. 

Pros: Delicious rolls. I also enjoyed the fact that there weren't a 100 rolls on the menu. Sake- I can't remember what it was called, but it tasted a lot like a sweet cider. I enjoy a good sake and the server let me sample some before I bought the bottle. They have a really good selection of different sakes. 918 crunchy roll- AMAZING! And on Tuesdays it is $3/roll. 

Cons: Volcano Roll, not a big fan of it, but it wasn't horrible. Just personal taste. The rolls were on the small side and fell apart easily.
